009package imagingbook.common.geometry.hulls;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.radius;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
014import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.add;
015import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.makeDoubleVector;
016import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.multiply;
017import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
018
019import java.awt.Shape;
020import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
021import java.util.Arrays;
022
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
027import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
028import imagingbook.common.util.ArrayIterator;
029
030/**
031 * <p>
032 * Represents a major axis-aligned bounding box of a 2D point set. At least one
033 * point is required to set up a bounding box. If the direction vector is
034 * undefined (e.g., in the case of a single input point), the unit vector in
035 * x-direction is assumed. See Sec. 8.6.4 (Alg. 8.6) of [1] for details.
036 * </p>
037 * <p>
038 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
039 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
040 * </p>
041 * 
042 * 
043 * @author WB
044 * @version 2022/11/01
045 */
046public class AxisAlignedBoundingBox implements ShapeProducer {
047        
048        private final Pnt2d centroid;   // centroid of the point set
049        private final double[] dir;             // orientation vector
050        private final Pnt2d[] corners;  // corner points of the bounding box
051        private final AlgebraicLine[] boundinglines;
052
053        /**
054         * Constructor, creates a {@link AxisAlignedBoundingBox} instance from
055         * an {@link Iterable} over {@link Pnt2d}. At least one distinct point is required.
056         * 
057         * @param points an iterator over 2D points
058         */
059        public AxisAlignedBoundingBox(Iterable<Pnt2d> points) {
060                if (!points.iterator().hasNext()) {
061                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("empty point sequence, at least one input point required");
062                }
063                this.centroid = PntUtils.centroid(points); //makeCentroid();    
064                this.dir = makeOrientationVector(points);
065                this.corners = makeBox(points);
066                this.boundinglines = makeBoundingLines();
067        }
068        
069        /**
070         * Constructor, creates a {@link AxisAlignedBoundingBox} instance from
071         * an array of {@link Pnt2d} points. At least one distinct point is required.
072         * 
073         * @param points an array of 2D points
074         */
075        public AxisAlignedBoundingBox(Pnt2d[] points) {
076                this(() -> ArrayIterator.from(points));
077        }
078        
079        /**
080         * Returns the orientation vector of this bounding box (pointing in the
081         * direction of its major axis).
082         * 
083         * @return the orientation vector of this bounding box
084         */
085        public double[] getOrientationVector() {
086                return dir;
087        }
088        
089        /**
090         * Returns an array of four {@link AlgebraicLine} instances which
091         * coincide with the outline of the bounding box. The lines can be used to determine
092         * if a given point is inside the box or not (see {@link #contains(Pnt2d, double)}).
093         * 
094         * @return an array of bounding lines
095         */
096        public AlgebraicLine[] getBoundingLines() {
097                return this.boundinglines;
098        }
099        
100        /**
101         * Returns an array holding the 4 corner points of the bounding box.
102         * 
103         * @return as described above
104         */
105        public Pnt2d[] getVertices() {
106                return this.corners;
107        }
108                
109        /**
110         * Calculates the major axis-aligned bounding box of the supplied region, as a
111         * sequence of four point coordinates (p0, p1, p2, p3).
112         * 
113         * @return the region's bounding box as a sequence of the 4 corner coordinates
114         *         (p0, p1, p2, p3)
115         */
116        private Pnt2d[] makeBox(Iterable<Pnt2d> points) {
117                //double theta = getOrientationAngle(points);
118                
119                double[] xy = this.dir;
120                if (xy == null) {       // regin's orientation is undefined
121                        return null;
122                }
123                        
124                double xa = xy[0]; // = Math.cos(theta);
125                double ya = xy[1]; // = Math.sin(theta);
126                double[] ea = {xa,  ya};
127                double[] eb = {ya, -xa};
128                
129                double amin = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
130                double amax = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
131                double bmin = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
132                double bmax = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
133                
134                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
135                        double u = p.getX();
136                        double v = p.getY();
137                        double a = u * xa + v * ya;     // project (u,v) on the major axis vector
138                        double b = u * ya - v * xa;     // project (u,v) on perpendicular vector
139                        amin = Math.min(a, amin);
140                        amax = Math.max(a, amax);
141                        bmin = Math.min(b, bmin);
142                        bmax = Math.max(b, bmax);
143                }
144                
145                Pnt2d[] corners = new Pnt2d[4];
146                corners[0] = PntDouble.from(add(multiply(amin, ea), multiply(bmin, eb)));
147                corners[1] = PntDouble.from(add(multiply(amin, ea), multiply(bmax, eb)));
148                corners[2] = PntDouble.from(add(multiply(amax, ea), multiply(bmax, eb)));
149                corners[3] = PntDouble.from(add(multiply(amax, ea), multiply(bmin, eb)));
150                return corners;
151        }
152
153        private double[] makeOrientationVector(Iterable<Pnt2d> points) {
154                double mu20 = 0;
155                double mu02 = 0;
156                double mu11 = 0;
157                double xc = centroid.getX();
158                double yc = centroid.getY();
159                
160                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
161                        double dx = p.getX() - xc;
162                        double dy = p.getY() - yc;
163                        mu20 = mu20 + dx * dx;
164                        mu02 = mu02 + dy * dy;
165                        mu11 = mu11 + dx * dy;
166                }
167                
168                double A = 2 * mu11;
169                double B = mu20 - mu02;
170                
171                double xTheta = B + sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B));
172                double yTheta = A;
173                double d = radius(xTheta, yTheta);
174                
175                return (isZero(d)) ? new double[] {1, 0} : new double[] {xTheta / d, yTheta / d};
176        }
177        
178        // shape-related methods:
179        
180        @Override
181        public Path2D getShape(double scale) {
182                // shape of the actual bounding box
183                Path2D p = new Path2D.Double(Path2D.WIND_NON_ZERO, 4);
184                p.moveTo(corners[0].getX(), corners[0].getY());
185                p.lineTo(corners[1].getX(), corners[1].getY());
186                p.lineTo(corners[2].getX(), corners[2].getY());
187                p.lineTo(corners[3].getX(), corners[3].getY());
188                p.closePath();
189                return p;
190        }
191        
192        @Override
193        public Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
194                return new Shape[] { 
195                                getShape(scale),                                // primary shape element
196                                this.centroid.getShape(scale)   // additional shape elements
197                                };
198        }
199        
200        private AlgebraicLine[] makeBoundingLines() {
201                double dx = dir[0];
202                double dy = dir[1];
203                return new AlgebraicLine[] {
204                                AlgebraicLine.from(corners[0].toDoubleArray(), makeDoubleVector( dy, -dx)),             // 0 -> 1
205                                AlgebraicLine.from(corners[1].toDoubleArray(), makeDoubleVector( dx,  dy)),             // 1 -> 2
206                                AlgebraicLine.from(corners[2].toDoubleArray(), makeDoubleVector(-dy,  dx)),             // 2 -> 3
207                                AlgebraicLine.from(corners[3].toDoubleArray(), makeDoubleVector(-dx, -dy))
208                                };      // 3 -> 0
209        }
210        
211        public static final double DefaultContainsTolerance = 1e-12;
212        
213        
214        /**
215         * Checks if this bounding box contains the specified point
216         * using the default tolerance.
217         * This method is used instead of {@link Path2D#contains(double, double)}
218         * to avoid false results due to roundoff errors.
219         * 
220         * @param p some 2D point
221         * @return true if the point is inside the bounding box
222         */
223        public boolean contains(Pnt2d p) {
224                return contains(p, DefaultContainsTolerance);
225        }
226        
227        /**
228         * Checks if this bounding box contains the specified point using the specified tolerance.
229         * This method is used instead of {@link Path2D#contains(double, double)}
230         * to avoid false results due to roundoff errors.
231         * 
232         * @param p some 2D point
233         * @param tolerance positive quantity for being outside
234         * @return true if the point is inside the bounding box
235         */
236        public boolean contains(Pnt2d p, double tolerance) {
237                for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
238                        double dist = boundinglines[i].getSignedDistance(p);
239                        // positive signed distance means that the point is to the left
240                        if (dist + tolerance < 0) {
241                                return false;
242                        }
243                }
244                return true;
245        }
246        
247        @Override
248        public String toString() {
249                return String.format("%s: %s", this.getClass().getSimpleName(), Arrays.toString(this.corners));
250        }
251}
